author: kfogel
msg: Fix issue #2842: filter ambient depth as well as requested depth.
(This is also part of issue #695.)
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(struct edit_baton): Change 'depth' to 'requested_depth'.
(struct dir_baton, struct file_baton): Add new 'ambient_depth' fields.
(make_dir_baton, make_file_baton): Flag whether or not this baton is
the end of the line by setting the depth field appropriately.
Return new baton by reference, to enable returning an error
directly if the new code raises an error.  In make_dir_baton, set
the depth to svn_depth_unknown if it is to be corrected later.
(open_directory, open_root, add_file_with_history, delete_entry,
change_dir_prop, close_directory, absent_file_or_dir, apply_textdelta,
change_file_prop): Adjust for above.
(add_directory, open_file, add_file): Same.  Note that this changes
the semantics slightly: previously, the new baton pointer might
have remained untouched if we returned early due to an error,
whereas now it will definitely have been set.  I don't think any
callers care about this; the previous behavior was just an
accident of how the code was written.

author: kfogel
msg: Fix issue #2582: Clarify utility of --quiet in 'svn status' built-in help.
* subversion/svn/main.c
(svn_cl__options): Improve global summary of -q option.
(svn_cl__cmd_table."status"): Describe how -q behaves for this subcommand.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/getopt_tests_data/svn_help--version_stdout,
subversion/tests/cmdline/getopt_tests_data/svn_help_log_switch_stdout:
Adjust accordingly.

author: glasser
msg: For SWIG-Python tests, use unique names for temp repositories, so that
multiple executions of the test suite don't stomp on each other (or on
future executions: client.py doesn't really clean up after itself).
(tempfile.mkdtemp would be better than tempfile.mktemp, but
subversion/bindings/swig/INSTALL claims we need to support way back to
Python 2.0.)
* subversion/bindings/swig/python/tests/trac/versioncontrol/tests/svn_fs.py
(REPOS_PATH): Use mktemp.
* subversion/bindings/swig/python/tests/client.py
(test_checkout, test_url_from_path, test_uuid_from_path): Use mktemp.

author: vgeorgescu
msg: Fix issues #2894 and #2955.
#2894 was a 1.5 regression that prevented repo->wc copies from working if the
URL needed URI-escaping.  #2955 was an older problem about the destination
of the repo->wc copy having URI escape sequences in its name after the copy.
* subversion/libsvn_client/copy.c
(repos_to_wc_copy): URI-decode pair->src_rel (i.e. the source path relative
to the RA session).  This fixes #2894.
(svn_client_copy4, setup_copy): For repo->wc copies, make sure the
destination is never URI-encoded.  This fixes #2955.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/copy_tests.py
(copy_multiple_repo_wc): Extend the test to cover issue #2955.
(URI_encoded_repos_to_wc): Fix a few problems with the test.
(test_list): Remove XFail marker from URI_encoded_repos_to_wc.

author: hwright
msg: Fix log test 24 and authz test 7 over ra_neon.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_neon/log.c
(log_start_element): Make a copy of the revprop name in the log entry pool,
ensuring that it exists long enough to be used by the receiver.
